abstract.text: Manage your customers’ App Store transactions from your server.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The App Store Server API is a REST API that you call from your server to request and provide information about your customers’ in-app purchases. The App Store signs the transaction and subscription renewal information that this API returns using the
specification. Most endpoints return data for a single customer of your app, indicated by a transaction identifier that you provide.

The App Store Server API is independent of the app’s installation status on the customers’ devices. The App Store server returns information based on a customer’s in-app purchase history regardless of whether the customer installs, removes, or reinstalls the app on their devices.
This API provides the following functionality:
Transactions and auto-renewable subscription status.
Get information for single transactions by calling
or a customer’s entire transaction history using
. Call
for up-to-date subscription status. Use this information to keep your customers’ purchase information current on your server.
Refund information.
Call
to get a customer’s refund history. Use the
endpoint to send information to the App Store when customers request a refund for a consumable in-app purchase, after you receive the
from
. Your data helps inform refund decisions.
App Store Server Notifications history and testing.
Call
to request the notifications your server may have missed in the past 180 days. Call
and
to test if your server is successfully receiving notifications at its
endpoint.
Subscription renewal date extensions.
Call

and related endpoints to compensate your customers for temporary service outages, canceled events, or interruptions to live-streamed events by extending the renewal date of their paid, active subscription. For more information, see
Order information lookup.
Call
to get in-app purchase information based on a customer’s order ID, found on the App Store receipt that customers receive in email.
Your server must support the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol 1.2 or later to use the App Store Server API.
Check the
to learn about the latest changes to this API. Look for videos about the App Store Server API on the
Calls to the API require JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) for authorization; you obtain keys to create the tokens from your organization’s App Store Connect account. See
to create your keys. See
to generate tokens using your keys, and send API requests.

After you have a complete and signed token, provide the token in the request’s authorization header as a bearer token. Generate a new token for each new API request, or reuse tokens until they expire.

content.text: Create JWTs, verify transactions, and more using the App Store Server Library

inlineContent.text: The App Store Server Library is an open source library from Apple, available in four languages. It provides a client that make it easier to adopt the App Store Server APIs, including creating the JWTs to authorize calls. For more information, see
and the WWDC23 session
All App Store Server API endpoints are available for testing in the sandbox environment, except
. Access the sandbox environment by sending requests to the endpoints using the following base URL:
For example, to call
in the sandbox environment, send a request using the sandbox URL:
Note that
in the path is case-sensitive.
For endpoints that take a
as a parameter, be sure to call the endpoint using the same environment that creates the transaction identifier. Environment information is present in the
property of the
If you don’t have environment information, follow these steps:
Call the endpoint using the production URL. If the call succeeds, the transaction identifier belongs to the production environment.
If you receive an error code
, call the endpoint using the sandbox environment.
If the call succeeds, the transaction identifier belongs to the sandbox environment. If the call fails with the
error code, the transaction identifier isn’t present in either environment.

abstract.text: Manage your customers’ App Store transactions from your server.
A response that contains the contents of the App Store server’s test notification and the result from your server.
The request body containing consumption information.
The request body that contains subscription-renewal-extension data for an individual subscription.
A response that indicates whether an individual renewal-date extension succeeded, and related details.
Get a customer’s in-app purchase transaction history for your app, except finished consumable in-app purchases.
Get a customer’s in-app purchases from a receipt using the order ID.
Check the status of the test App Store server notification sent to your server.
Get a list of up to 50 of a customer’s refunded in-app purchases for your app.
Get the statuses for all of a customer’s auto-renewable subscriptions in your app.
Checks whether a renewal date extension request completed, and provides the final count of successful or failed extensions.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Get Status of Subscription Renewal Date Extensions

abstract.text: Get information about a single transaction for your app.
Get a customer’s in-app purchase transaction history for your app.
Get a paginated list of all of a customer’s refunded in-app purchases for your app.
A response that contains the customer’s transaction history for an app.
A decoded JSON Web Signature (JWS) header containing transaction or renewal information.
Subscription renewal information, signed by the App Store, in JSON Web Signature (JWS) format.
A decoded payload containing subscription renewal information for an auto-renewable subscription.
Transaction information signed by the App Store, in JSON Web Signature (JWS) Compact Serialization format.
A decoded payload that contains transaction information.
The request body that contains subscription-renewal-extension data to apply for all eligible active subscribers.
A response that indicates the server successfully received the subscription-renewal-date extension request.
A response that indicates the current status of a request to extend the subscription renewal date to all eligible subscribers.
The request body for notification history.
A response that contains the App Store Server Notifications history for your app.
A response that includes the order lookup status and an array of signed transactions for the in-app purchases in the order.
Get a list of notifications that the App Store server attempted to send to your server.
Ask App Store Server Notifications to send a test notification to your server.
Uses a subscription’s product identifier to extend the renewal date for all of its eligible active subscribers.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Extend Subscription Renewal Dates for All Active Subscribers

abstract.text: Extends the renewal date of a customer’s active subscription using the original transaction identifier.
Send consumption information about a consumable in-app purchase or auto-renewable subscription to the App Store after your server receives a consumption request notification.
A response that contains an array of signed JSON Web Signature (JWS) refunded transactions, and paging information.
A response that contains an array of signed JSON Web Signature (JWS) transactions.
A response that contains the test notification token.
A response that contains status information for all of a customer’s auto-renewable subscriptions in your app.
An error that indicates a transaction identifier wasn’t found.
A response that contains signed transaction information for a single transaction.
Learn about new features and updates in the App Store Server API.
Create API keys you use to sign JSON Web Tokens and authorize API requests.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Creating API keys to authorize API requests

abstract.text: Refer to these data types for decoded transaction and renewal information payloads.
The server environment, either sandbox or production.
Understand the error codes that App Store Server API responses return.
Compensate eligible active subscribers for service interruptions by extending a subscription’s renewal date.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Extending the renewal date for auto-renewable subscriptions

abstract.text: Create JSON Web Tokens signed with your private key to authorize requests for App Store Server API and External Purchase Server API.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Generating JSON Web Tokens for API requests

abstract.text: Recognize the rate limits that apply to App Store Server API endpoints and handle them in your code.
The App Store server notification history record, including the signed notification payload and the result of the server’s first send attempt.
The customer’s order ID from an App Store receipt for in-app purchases.
Use Apple’s open source library to create JSON Web Tokens (JWT) to authorize your calls, verify transactions, extract transaction identifiers from receipts, and more.

doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/docume.title: Simplifying your implementation by using the App Store Server Library

abstract.text: The unique identifier for a transaction, such as an In-App Purchase, restored In-App Purchase, or subscription renewal.
Specify your secure server’s URL in App Store Connect to receive version 2 notifications.
The type that describes the in-app purchase or external purchase event for which the App Store sends the version 2 notification.
